document.masterDocTitle: A checklist of the amphibians and reptiles of Honduras, with additions, comments on taxonomy, some recent taxonomic decisions, and areas of further studies needed

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A checklist of the amphibians and reptiles of Honduras, with additions, comments on taxonomy, some recent taxonomic decisions, and areas of further studies needed

subSubSection.paragraph: ( 21 genera, 43 species, 5 endemic species). Oppel used Colubrini in his key to the Ophidii.

Coluber mentovarius
(A.M.C. Duméril, Bibron & Duméril 1854 a, 187 ).
Solís et al. ( 2014 )
considered this species a member of the genus
Masticophis Baird & Girard
( 1853 [p. 98 ]). I disagree with their comments and think that if
Masticophis
is to be retained, it will be strictly for the striped and somewhat smaller species occurring in the southwestern USA and Mexico ( type species
M. taeniata
[Hallowell 1854 p. 181 ]) and not for the
Coluber
- like species
C. mentovarius
and relatives. Study is needed of the
Coluber - Masticophis
problem.

Dendrophidion rufiterminorum Cadle &
Savage 2012
, 23. Unlike stated by
Solís et al . ( 2014 )
,
McCranie ( 2011 a)
did not use
D. nuchale
(Peters 1863 [p. 285 ]) for Honduran populations (he used
D. clarkii Dunn 1933
b [p. 78 ]).

Drymarchon melanurus
(A.M.C. Duméril, Bibron & Duméril 1854 a, 224 )

Ficimia Gray 1849
, 80 ( 1 species)
Ficimia publia Cope 1866
, 126

Lampropeltis abnorma
(Bocourt 1886 , legend page for plate XXXIX in A.H.A. Duméril et al.
1870–1909
)

Leptophis ahaetulla
(Linnaeus 1758, 225 ). This species represents a complex of several species. Nelson Albuquerque plans to elevate several “subspecies” of this geographically wide-ranging nominal form to the species level (pers. comm.).

Leptophis depressirostris
(Cope 1861, 557 ). Honduran specimens of this species have significantly fewer subcaudal scales than do those from further south.

Leptophis mexicanus
(A.M.C. Duméril, Bibron & Duméril 1854 a, 536 )

Mastigodryas alternatus
(Bocourt 1884, 133 ). Despite saying they were documenting all name changes subsequent to the
McCranie ( 2009 )
list,
Solís et al. ( 2014 )
did not note that
McCranie ( 2011 a)
resurrected this species name from the synonymy of
M. melanolomus
.

Mastigodryas dorsalis
(Bocourt
1890, 724 in
A.H.A. Duméril et al.
1870–1909
)

Oxybelis
Wagler 1830
, 183 ( 4 species, 1 endemic species)
Oxybelis aeneus
(Wagler 1824, 12 )

Phrynonax poecilonotus
(Günther 1858, 100 ).
Solís et al. ( 2014 )
, despite their claim, failed to document this genus name change subsequent to the
McCranie ( 2009 )
checklist. Jadin et al. ( 2013 ) transferred this species from
Pseustes Fitzinger
( 1843 [p. 27 ]) to
Phrynonax
and also detected what appears to be an undescribed genetic “lineage” of this nominal form in Guatemala and Honduras . Jadin et al. ( 2013 ) also overlooked the comments of
McCranie ( 2011 a)
regarding the type locality of
P. poecilonotus
( type locality in Belize , not Honduras ).

Pseudelaphe Mertens & Rosenberg 1943
, 61 ( 1 species)
Pseudelaphe flavirufa
(Cope 1867, 319 )

Senticolis Dowling & Fries 1987
, 202 ( 1 species)
Senticolis triaspis
(Cope 1866, 128 )

Spilotes
Wagler 1830
, 179 ( 1 species). Jadin et al. ( 2013 ) recovered preliminary genetic evidence that more than one species was involved under this genus and its single currently recognized species.
Spilotes pullatus
(Linnaeus 1758, 225 )

Stenorrhina freminvillii A.M.C. Duméril, Bibron & Duméril 1854
b, 868

Tantilla Baird & Girard 1853
, 131 ( 9 species, 4 endemic species)

Tantilla olympia
(E) Townsend, Wilson, Medina-Flores & Herrera-B. 2013, 194

Tantilla schistosa
(Bocourt
1883, 584 in
A.H.A. Duméril et al.
1870–1909
)

Tantilla taeniata
(Bocourt
1883, 587 in
A.H.A. Duméril et al.
1870–1909
). This nominal form seems to represent a species complex among the populations in El Salvador , Guatemala , and Honduras (
McCranie 2011 b
).

Tantillita H. Smith 1941
, 117 ( 1 species)
Tantillita lintoni
(H. Smith 1940, 61 )

Trimorphodon Cope 1862
, 297 ( 1 species).
Solís et al. ( 2014 )
listed the publication date of 1861 for the Cope description of this genus.
